column2: Whole grain bread, Avocado, Salt, Pepper, Red pepper flakes, Cherry tomatoes, Olive oil
column4: 2. Mash avocado and spread it evenly on the toast.
column5: 3. Sprinkle with salt pepper and red pepper flakes to taste.
column6: 4. Optionally top with sliced cherry tomatoes and a drizzle of olive oil.

column2: Chia seeds, Coconut milk, Maple syrup (or other sweetener), Vanilla extract, Mixed berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
column3: 1. In a bowl mix chia seeds coconut milk maple syrup and vanilla extract.
column4: 2. Stir well and let it sit in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or overnight until thickened.

column2: Oats, Bananas, Apples, Cinnamon, Maple syrup
column3: 1. Cook oats according to package instructions.
column4: 2. Once cooked top with sliced bananas diced apples and a sprinkle of cinnamon.
column5: 3. Optionally add a drizzle of maple syrup for sweetness.

column2: Whole wheat flour, Baking powder, Almond milk, Apple cider vinegar, Maple syrup, Vanilla extract, Fresh fruit (such as berries, banana slices)
column3: 1. In a mixing bowl whisk together whole wheat flour and baking powder.
column4: 2. In a separate bowl mix almond milk and apple cider vinegar and let it sit for a few minutes to curdle.
column5: 3. Add maple syrup and vanilla extract to the almond milk mixture.
column6: 4. Combine wet and dry ingredients until just mixed.
column7: 5. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and pour batter to form pancakes.
column8: 6. Cook until bubbles form on the surface then flip and cook until golden brown.
column9: 7. Serve topped with fresh fruit and additional maple syrup if desired.

column2: Extra-firm tofu, Turmeric, Nutritional yeast, Garlic powder, Onion powder, Bell peppers, Spinach, Cherry tomatoes, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
column4: 2. Crumble tofu into the skillet and season with turmeric nutritional yeast garlic powder onion powder salt and pepper.
column5: 3. Cook for a few minutes then add chopped bell peppers spinach and cherry tomatoes.
column6: 4. Cook until vegetables are tender and tofu is heated through.

column2: Quinoa, Mixed vegetables (such as cucumber, bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, red onion), Chickpeas, Lemon juice, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Fresh herbs (such as parsley, cilantro)
column3: 1. Cook quinoa according to package instructions and let it cool.
column4: 2. In a large bowl combine cooked quinoa mixed vegetables and chickpeas. 3. Drizzle with lemon juice and olive oil and season with salt pepper and fresh herbs. 4. Toss to combine and serve chilled.

column2: Whole wheat tortilla, Avocado, Black beans, Corn, Red onion, Cilantro, Lime juice, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Mash avocado in a bowl and season with lime juice salt and pepper.
column4: 2. Spread mashed avocado on a whole wheat tortilla.
column5: 3. Top with black beans corn diced red onion and chopped cilantro.
column7: 5. Slice the wrap in half and serve.

column2: Quinoa, Mixed greens (such as lettuce, spinach, kale), Roasted sweet potatoes, Chickpeas, Avocado, Cherry tomatoes, Cucumber, Tahini dressing (tahini, lemon juice, water, garlic, salt)
column3: 1. Cook quinoa according to package instructions and set aside.
column4: 2. Arrange mixed greens in a bowl and top with cooked quinoa roasted sweet potatoes chickpeas sliced avocado halved cherry tomatoes and sliced cucumber.

column2: Chickpeas, Celery, Red onion, Pickles, Dijon mustard, Lemon juice, Fresh dill, Salt, Pepper, Whole grain bread, Lettuce, Tomato, Avocado (optional)
column3: 1. Drain and rinse chickpeas then mash them in a bowl with a fork.
column4: 2. Finely chop celery red onion and pickles and add them to the mashed chickpeas.
column5: 3. Stir in Dijon mustard lemon juice chopped fresh dill salt and pepper.
column6: 4. Spread chickpea salad on whole grain bread slices.
column7: 5. Top with lettuce tomato and sliced avocado if desired.
column8: 6. Cover with another slice of bread to make a sandwich.
column9: 7. Serve immediately or wrap in foil for later.

column2: Lentils, Mixed vegetables (such as carrots, celery, onion, bell peppers), Vegetable broth, Crushed tomatoes, Garlic, Bay leaves, Thyme, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
column4: 2. Add diced onion carrots celery and bell peppers to the pot and cook until softened.
column5: 3. Stir in minced garlic and cook for another minute.
column6: 4. Add lentils vegetable broth crushed tomatoes bay leaves thyme salt and pepper to the pot.
column7: 5. Bring the soup to a boil then reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until lentils are tender.

column2: Chickpeas, Coconut milk, Tomato sauce, Onion, Garlic, Ginger, Curry powder, Turmeric, Cumin, Coriander, Cayenne pepper, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Fresh cilantro, Cooked rice (for serving)
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat.
column4: 2. Add diced onion minced garlic and grated ginger to the skillet and cook until softened and fragrant.
column5: 3. Stir in curry powder turmeric cumin coriander and cayenne pepper and cook for another minute.
column6: 4. Add chickpeas coconut milk and tomato sauce to the skillet.
column7: 5. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 15-20 minutes stirring occasionally.
column8: 6. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
column9: 7. Serve chickpea curry over cooked rice and garnish with chopped fresh cilantro.

column2: Mixed mushrooms (such as cremini, shiitake, oyster), Bell peppers, Broccoli, Snow peas, Garlic, Ginger, Soy sauce, Rice vinegar, Maple syrup, Cornstarch, Olive oil, Sesame seeds, Green onions
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
column4: 2. Add minced garlic and ginger and cook until fragrant.
column5: 3. Add sliced mushrooms and cook until they release their moisture and start to brown.
column6: 4. Add sliced bell peppers broccoli florets and snow peas to the skillet and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
column7: 5. In a small bowl whisk together soy sauce rice vinegar maple syrup and cornstarch.
column8: 6. Pour the sauce over the vegetables in the skillet and toss to coat.
column9: 7. Cook for another minute until the sauce thickens.
column10: 8. Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions before serving.

column2: Cauliflower, Taco seasoning, Corn tortillas, Red cabbage, Avocado, Lime wedges, Fresh cilantro, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column4: 2. Cut cauliflower into small florets and toss with olive oil and taco seasoning on a baking sheet.
column5: 3. Roast cauliflower in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until tender and slightly browned.
column6: 4. Warm corn tortillas in a skillet or microwave.
column7: 5. Assemble tacos by filling each tortilla with roasted cauliflower shredded red cabbage sliced avocado and fresh cilantro.
column8: 6. Serve with lime wedges for squeezing.

column1: Vegan Sweet Potato and Black Bean Enchiladas
column2: Sweet potatoes, Black beans, Onion, Garlic, Cumin, Chili powder, Paprika, Corn tortillas, Enchilada sauce, Avocado, Fresh cilantro, Lime wedges
column4: 2. Peel and dice sweet potatoes then toss with olive oil minced garlic cumin chili powder paprika salt and pepper on a baking sheet.
column5: 3. Roast sweet potatoes in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until tender.
column6: 4. In a large bowl mash black beans with diced onion minced garlic and spices.
column7: 5. Warm corn tortillas in the microwave or a skillet.
column8: 6. Spread a spoonful of enchilada sauce in the bottom of a baking dish.
column9: 7. Fill each tortilla with a scoop of the black bean mixture and roasted sweet potatoes then roll tightly and place seam-side down in the baking dish.
column10: 8. Pour remaining enchilada sauce over the filled tortillas.
column11: 9. Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until heated through.
column12: 10. Serve enchiladas with sliced avocado fresh cilantro and lime wedges.

column2: Extra-firm tofu, Mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, snap peas), Soy sauce, Garlic, Ginger, Olive oil, Sesame oil, Cornstarch, Green onions, Sesame seeds
column3: 1. Press tofu to remove excess moisture then cut into cubes.
column4: 2. Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
column5: 3. Add cubed tofu to the skillet and cook until lightly browned on all sides.
column6: 4. Remove tofu from the skillet and set aside.
column7: 5. In the same skillet add a little more olive oil if needed then add minced garlic and ginger and cook until fragrant.
column8: 6. Add mixed vegetables to the skillet and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
column9: 7. In a small bowl whisk together soy sauce sesame oil and cornstarch.
column10: 8. Pour the sauce over the vegetables in the skillet and cook until thickened.
column11: 9. Add the cooked tofu back to the skillet and toss to coat.
column12: 10. Garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds before serving.
